data.author: draft
data.content: Investor interest in natural hydrogen and helium is growing across the globe. Reflecting this trend, Kingfisher anticipates expanding its exploration strategy for both resources and, to support this, Getech and Kingfisher have also signed a strategic collaboration agreement to facilitate extending the working relationship beyond Q1 2025. Richard Bennett, CEO at Getech, commented: “We are delighted to be working with the Kingfisher team. Hydrogen and Helium are nascent industries, but we are becoming increasingly well placed in both markets. Made possible by our industry leading gravity and magnetic data set that covers the whole globe coupled to our market leading interpretation capabilities. This is a significant commercial advantage and one we will bring to bear to support Kingfisher commercialise their exploration objectives.” Brian Glover and and Murray Rodgers, Co-Chair/CEO’s at Kingfisher, commented: “With Getech’s world-class geoscience solutions and their track record in resource exploration, we are well-positioned to advance our natural hydrogen and helium projects. This collaboration strengthens our ability to deliver on our commitment to pioneering clean energy solutions in North America.”

data.author: draft
data.content: Https://getech.com/news/getech-to-support-kingfisher-in-exploring-for-hydrogen-and-helium-accumulations/?utm_source=email&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=mar_2025_newsletter

data.author: draft
data.content: Licensing Round Opportunities Several major licensing rounds have been recently announced, opening new opportunities for oil and gas exploration: Brazil: The next oil & gas licensing round on 17 June will offer 332 exploratory blocks across key onshore and offshore basins. Thailand: The 25th Licensing Round will offer nine onshore blocks, with bid submissions due 1-16 July. Seven blocks are in the northeast of the country, while two are in the central region. India: The 10th round of the Open Acreage Licensing Policy (OALP) is the largest by acreage to date, covering 191,986 sq km across 25 blocks in shallow, deep and ultra-deep waters. Libya: Set to launch its first bidding round in over 17 years, with majors like Eni, OMV, BP and Repsol already resuming exploration in the country. Our Regional Exploration Packages provide the critical geoscience data and insights you need to de-risk your bids and maximise exploration success.
data.thread_title: Licensing Round Opportunities  Several major licensing rounds have ...

data.author: draft
data.content: Unlocking New Hydrogen and Helium Opportunities We continue to strengthen our position as a leader in natural hydrogen and helium exploration with three new strategic agreements. Canada: Kingfisher Energy Corporation has awarded Getech two contracts to explore an overlooked fairway with significant hydrogen and helium potential. Getech is conducting a comprehensive data-led analysis of the key areas of interest, leveraging its subsurface focused AI capabilities. Read more here. Morocco: Getech is working with Sound Energy PLC to evaluate natural hydrogen and helium potential in Morocco, applying its world-renowned gravity and magnetics database, along with its advanced geoscience platform, Globe, and machine learning expertise to identify key resource opportunities. Read more here. Global Expansion: A new collaboration with NH Ventures, the world’s first natural hydrogen investment fund, combines Getech’s exploration expertise with NH Ventures’ financial backing, supporting investment in low-carbon hydrogen projects worldwide. Read more here.

data.author: Laura2022
data.content: ScottishPower and its parent company, Iberdrola, are driving the development of green hydrogen production in the UK by leveraging Iberdrola's global experience and successful track record of delivering green hydrogen production projects in Spain and developing projects across eight countries. Two of ScottishPower’s leading projects in the UK were successful in the Government’s first Hydrogen Allocation Round, which were two of the first three projects to sign Low Carbon Hydrogen Agreements in December 2024.  These two projects are the 10MW facility at Whitelee Windfarm and the 15MW facility in Cromarty in partnership with Storegga. Both projects will supply green hydrogen to whisky distilleries and their supply chain in Scotland.  ScottishPower is also taking forward a feasibility study for a 100MW production plant at the Port of Felixstowe with support from the UK Government’s Net Zero Hydrogen Fund. ScottishPower is advancing key projects that align with the UK Government’s hydrogen strategy, decarbonising critical sectors through renewable energy.

data.author: draft
data.content: Investor interest in natural hydrogen and helium is growing across the globe. Reflecting this trend, Kingfisher anticipates expanding its exploration strategy for both resources and, to support this, Getech and Kingfisher have also signed a strategic collaboration agreement to facilitate extending the working relationship beyond Q1 2025. Richard Bennett, CEO at Getech, commented: “We are delighted to be working with the Kingfisher team. Hydrogen and Helium are nascent industries, but we are becoming increasingly well placed in both markets. Made possible by our industry leading gravity and magnetic data set that covers the whole globe coupled to our market leading interpretation capabilities. This is a significant commercial advantage and one we will bring to bear to support Kingfisher commercialise their exploration objectives.” Brian Glover and and Murray Rodgers, Co-Chair/CEO’s at Kingfisher, commented: “With Getech’s world-class geoscience solutions and their track record in resource exploration, we are well-positioned to advance our natural hydrogen and helium projects. This collaboration strengthens our ability to deliver on our commitment to pioneering clean energy solutions in North America.”

data.author: draft
data.content: Licensing Round Opportunities Several major licensing rounds have been recently announced, opening new opportunities for oil and gas exploration: Brazil: The next oil & gas licensing round on 17 June will offer 332 exploratory blocks across key onshore and offshore basins. Thailand: The 25th Licensing Round will offer nine onshore blocks, with bid submissions due 1-16 July. Seven blocks are in the northeast of the country, while two are in the central region. India: The 10th round of the Open Acreage Licensing Policy (OALP) is the largest by acreage to date, covering 191,986 sq km across 25 blocks in shallow, deep and ultra-deep waters. Libya: Set to launch its first bidding round in over 17 years, with majors like Eni, OMV, BP and Repsol already resuming exploration in the country. Our Regional Exploration Packages provide the critical geoscience data and insights you need to de-risk your bids and maximise exploration success.
data.thread_title: Licensing Round Opportunities  Several major licensing rounds have ...

data.author: draft
data.content: Unlocking New Hydrogen and Helium Opportunities We continue to strengthen our position as a leader in natural hydrogen and helium exploration with three new strategic agreements. Canada: Kingfisher Energy Corporation has awarded Getech two contracts to explore an overlooked fairway with significant hydrogen and helium potential. Getech is conducting a comprehensive data-led analysis of the key areas of interest, leveraging its subsurface focused AI capabilities. Read more here. Morocco: Getech is working with Sound Energy PLC to evaluate natural hydrogen and helium potential in Morocco, applying its world-renowned gravity and magnetics database, along with its advanced geoscience platform, Globe, and machine learning expertise to identify key resource opportunities. Read more here. Global Expansion: A new collaboration with NH Ventures, the world’s first natural hydrogen investment fund, combines Getech’s exploration expertise with NH Ventures’ financial backing, supporting investment in low-carbon hydrogen projects worldwide. Read more here.

data.author: Laura2022
data.content: ScottishPower and its parent company, Iberdrola, are driving the development of green hydrogen production in the UK by leveraging Iberdrola's global experience and successful track record of delivering green hydrogen production projects in Spain and developing projects across eight countries. Two of ScottishPower’s leading projects in the UK were successful in the Government’s first Hydrogen Allocation Round, which were two of the first three projects to sign Low Carbon Hydrogen Agreements in December 2024.  These two projects are the 10MW facility at Whitelee Windfarm and the 15MW facility in Cromarty in partnership with Storegga. Both projects will supply green hydrogen to whisky distilleries and their supply chain in Scotland.  ScottishPower is also taking forward a feasibility study for a 100MW production plant at the Port of Felixstowe with support from the UK Government’s Net Zero Hydrogen Fund. ScottishPower is advancing key projects that align with the UK Government’s hydrogen strategy, decarbonising critical sectors through renewable energy.

data.author: draft
data.content: Investor interest in natural hydrogen and helium is growing across the globe. Reflecting this trend, Kingfisher anticipates expanding its exploration strategy for both resources and, to support this, Getech and Kingfisher have also signed a strategic collaboration agreement to facilitate extending the working relationship beyond Q1 2025. Richard Bennett, CEO at Getech, commented: “We are delighted to be working with the Kingfisher team. Hydrogen and Helium are nascent industries, but we are becoming increasingly well placed in both markets. Made possible by our industry leading gravity and magnetic data set that covers the whole globe coupled to our market leading interpretation capabilities. This is a significant commercial advantage and one we will bring to bear to support Kingfisher commercialise their exploration objectives.” Brian Glover and and Murray Rodgers, Co-Chair/CEO’s at Kingfisher, commented: “With Getech’s world-class geoscience solutions and their track record in resource exploration, we are well-positioned to advance our natural hydrogen and helium projects. This collaboration strengthens our ability to deliver on our commitment to pioneering clean energy solutions in North America.”

data.author: draft
data.content: Https://getech.com/news/getech-to-support-kingfisher-in-exploring-for-hydrogen-and-helium-accumulations/?utm_source=email&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=mar_2025_newsletter

data.author: draft
data.content: Licensing Round Opportunities Several major licensing rounds have been recently announced, opening new opportunities for oil and gas exploration: Brazil: The next oil & gas licensing round on 17 June will offer 332 exploratory blocks across key onshore and offshore basins. Thailand: The 25th Licensing Round will offer nine onshore blocks, with bid submissions due 1-16 July. Seven blocks are in the northeast of the country, while two are in the central region. India: The 10th round of the Open Acreage Licensing Policy (OALP) is the largest by acreage to date, covering 191,986 sq km across 25 blocks in shallow, deep and ultra-deep waters. Libya: Set to launch its first bidding round in over 17 years, with majors like Eni, OMV, BP and Repsol already resuming exploration in the country. Our Regional Exploration Packages provide the critical geoscience data and insights you need to de-risk your bids and maximise exploration success.
data.thread_title: Licensing Round Opportunities  Several major licensing rounds have ...

data.author: draft
data.content: Unlocking New Hydrogen and Helium Opportunities We continue to strengthen our position as a leader in natural hydrogen and helium exploration with three new strategic agreements. Canada: Kingfisher Energy Corporation has awarded Getech two contracts to explore an overlooked fairway with significant hydrogen and helium potential. Getech is conducting a comprehensive data-led analysis of the key areas of interest, leveraging its subsurface focused AI capabilities. Read more here. Morocco: Getech is working with Sound Energy PLC to evaluate natural hydrogen and helium potential in Morocco, applying its world-renowned gravity and magnetics database, along with its advanced geoscience platform, Globe, and machine learning expertise to identify key resource opportunities. Read more here. Global Expansion: A new collaboration with NH Ventures, the world’s first natural hydrogen investment fund, combines Getech’s exploration expertise with NH Ventures’ financial backing, supporting investment in low-carbon hydrogen projects worldwide. Read more here.

data.author: Laura2022
data.content: ScottishPower and its parent company, Iberdrola, are driving the development of green hydrogen production in the UK by leveraging Iberdrola's global experience and successful track record of delivering green hydrogen production projects in Spain and developing projects across eight countries. Two of ScottishPower’s leading projects in the UK were successful in the Government’s first Hydrogen Allocation Round, which were two of the first three projects to sign Low Carbon Hydrogen Agreements in December 2024.  These two projects are the 10MW facility at Whitelee Windfarm and the 15MW facility in Cromarty in partnership with Storegga. Both projects will supply green hydrogen to whisky distilleries and their supply chain in Scotland.  ScottishPower is also taking forward a feasibility study for a 100MW production plant at the Port of Felixstowe with support from the UK Government’s Net Zero Hydrogen Fund. ScottishPower is advancing key projects that align with the UK Government’s hydrogen strategy, decarbonising critical sectors through renewable energy.

Libya: Set to launch its first bidding round in over 17 years, with majors like Eni, OMV, BP and Repsol already resuming exploration in the country. Our Regional Exploration Packages provide the critical geoscience data and insights you need to de-risk your bids and maximise exploration success.

data.author: draft
data.content: Unlocking New Hydrogen and Helium Opportunities We continue to strengthen our position as a leader in natural hydrogen and helium exploration with three new strategic agreements. Canada: Kingfisher Energy Corporation has awarded Getech two contracts to explore an overlooked fairway with significant hydrogen and helium potential. Getech is conducting a comprehensive data-led analysis of the key areas of interest, leveraging its subsurface focused AI capabilities. Read more here. Morocco: Getech is working with Sound Energy PLC to evaluate natural hydrogen and helium potential in Morocco, applying its world-renowned gravity and magnetics database, along with its advanced geoscience platform, Globe, and machine learning expertise to identify key resource opportunities. Read more here. Global Expansion: A new collaboration with NH Ventures, the world’s first natural hydrogen investment fund, combines Getech’s exploration expertise with NH Ventures’ financial backing, supporting investment in low-carbon hydrogen projects worldwide. Read more here.

data.author: Laura2022
data.content: ScottishPower and its parent company, Iberdrola, are driving the development of green hydrogen production in the UK by leveraging Iberdrola's global experience and successful track record of delivering green hydrogen production projects in Spain and developing projects across eight countries. Two of ScottishPower’s leading projects in the UK were successful in the Government’s first Hydrogen Allocation Round, which were two of the first three projects to sign Low Carbon Hydrogen Agreements in December 2024.  These two projects are the 10MW facility at Whitelee Windfarm and the 15MW facility in Cromarty in partnership with Storegga. Both projects will supply green hydrogen to whisky distilleries and their supply chain in Scotland.  ScottishPower is also taking forward a feasibility study for a 100MW production plant at the Port of Felixstowe with support from the UK Government’s Net Zero Hydrogen Fund. ScottishPower is advancing key projects that align with the UK Government’s hydrogen strategy, decarbonising critical sectors through renewable energy.

data.author: draft
data.content: Investor interest in natural hydrogen and helium is growing across the globe. Reflecting this trend, Kingfisher anticipates expanding its exploration strategy for both resources and, to support this, Getech and Kingfisher have also signed a strategic collaboration agreement to facilitate extending the working relationship beyond Q1 2025. Richard Bennett, CEO at Getech, commented: “We are delighted to be working with the Kingfisher team. Hydrogen and Helium are nascent industries, but we are becoming increasingly well placed in both markets. Made possible by our industry leading gravity and magnetic data set that covers the whole globe coupled to our market leading interpretation capabilities. This is a significant commercial advantage and one we will bring to bear to support Kingfisher commercialise their exploration objectives.” Brian Glover and and Murray Rodgers, Co-Chair/CEO’s at Kingfisher, commented: “With Getech’s world-class geoscience solutions and their track record in resource exploration, we are well-positioned to advance our natural hydrogen and helium projects. This collaboration strengthens our ability to deliver on our commitment to pioneering clean energy solutions in North America.”
